We have to keep standing up to protect the free and open internet -- not just for today‚Äôs consumers, but for students -- the next generation of American innovators. That's what I'll be voting for today.

While broadband companies may have rejoiced after President Trump‚Äôs FCC moved to dissolve net neutrality rules and allow corporations to charge more for faster speeds, families across our country spoke up and made their voices heard loud and clear that this was unacceptable.
Net neutrality rules help ensure that consumers ‚Äì not broadband providers ‚Äì get to pick the websites they visit or applications they use.
In just a few moments, I‚Äôm going to join my colleagues on the Senate floor to vote YES on legislation to save #NetNeutrality and lift up the voices of the people I represent in Washington state.
